step_by_step.explanation: 1) All living things are made of cells, 2) Cells are the basic units of life, 3) All cells come from pre-existing cells.

problems.final_answer: Cell theory: All living things are made of cells, cells are the basic units of life, and all cells come from pre-existing cells.

problems.problem: Differentiate between prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.

step_by_step.explanation: No nucleus, no membrane-bound organelles, generally smaller and simpler.
Have a nucleus and membrane-bound organelles, generally larger and more complex.

problems.final_answer: Prokaryotic: no nucleus, simpler; Eukaryotic: nucleus and organelles, more complex.

problems.problem: Describe the function of the cell membrane.

step_by_step.explanation: A phospholipid bilayer surrounding the cell.
Controls the movement of substances in and out of the cell and provides protection.

problems.final_answer: The cell membrane controls transport of materials and protects the cell.

problems.problem: Explain the function of the nucleus.

step_by_step.explanation: Controls cell activities and stores genetic information.

problems.final_answer: The nucleus controls cell activities and stores DNA.

problems.problem: List three differences between plant and animal cells.

step_by_step.explanation: Cell wall, chloroplasts, large central vacuole.
No cell wall, no chloroplasts, smaller vacuoles.

problems.final_answer: Plant cells have cell walls, chloroplasts, and large vacuoles; animal cells do not.

problems.problem: Explain the role of mitochondria in the cell.

step_by_step.explanation: Membrane-bound organelle known as the 'powerhouse' of the cell.

problems.final_answer: Mitochondria produce ATP, providing energy for the cell.

step_by_step.explanation: Small organelles found in cytoplasm or on rough ER.
Synthesize proteins according to mRNA instructions.

problems.final_answer: Ribosomes synthesize proteins based on genetic instructions.

problems.problem: Explain the role of the endoplasmic reticulum (ER).

step_by_step.explanation: Has ribosomes; synthesizes and processes proteins.
No ribosomes; synthesizes lipids and detoxifies substances.

problems.final_answer: ER synthesizes proteins (rough ER) and lipids/detoxifies substances (smooth ER).

problems.problem: Explain the function of the Golgi apparatus.

step_by_step.explanation: Stacked membrane-bound sacs in the cell.
Modifies, sorts, and packages proteins and lipids for transport.

problems.final_answer: Golgi apparatus modifies, sorts, and packages proteins and lipids for transport.

problems.problem: Explain why cells are small in size.

step_by_step.explanation: Small size increases surface area relative to volume, allowing efficient exchange of materials.
Helps cells obtain nutrients and remove wastes effectively.

problems.final_answer: Cells are small to maximize surface area for efficient nutrient uptake and waste removal.
